page.description: Returns which word matches (1 based,0 means no match).
page.syntax: Position as N = WORDAT(C word,C string[,C separator])

argument.name: word
argument.description: The word to find in Input_String. Character

argument.name: separator
argument.description: Optional. Default = space (" "). The character string that separates words.

page.discussion: WORDAT() returns the word number of Word in string. Case insensitive. If the optional separator parameter is not specified, a word is any sequence of one or more characters separated either by a space or the start or end of the string. WORDAT() is a case insensitive version of WORDATC().
page.example: wordat("test", "This is a test") -> 4 dim fruits as C fruits = "apple" + crlf() + "banana" + crlf() + "grape" + crlf() + "peach" + crlf() + "plum" wordat("banana", fruits, crlf() ) ? 2
